articles.title: ‘Utter hypocrisy’: tobacco firm lobbied against rules in Africa that are law in UK
articles.description: British American Tobacco pushed Zambian ministers to drop or delay ad bans, health warnings and restrictions on flavoured products, letter showsBritish American Tobacco has been accused of “utter hypocrisy” for lobbying against tobacco control measures in Africa that are already in place in the UK.A

articles.title: Edmonton Oilers scratch out a two-game win streak with consecutive OT winners: Cult of Hockey Player Grades
articles.description: The Edmonton Oilers were the better team over sixty-plus minutes but still had to squeak out a 2-1 Overtime victory Wednesday in Philadelphia. The Oilers dominated over forty minutes. The shots were 13-5 in the first, with no Philadelphia shots over the final eight. In fact, Edmonton had 14 in a row

articles.title: Kelowna’s unemployment rate jumps again, worse than height of COVID-19 pandemic
articles.description: According to Statistics Canada, the jobless rate in the Kelowna area rose to 9.3 per cent in October, an increase of 2.2 per cent in just one month – the 2nd highest in B.C.

articles.title: Roslovic comes up with second overtime goal in as many games for Edmonton Oilers
articles.description: One down, six more to go. The Edmonton Oilers opened a stretch of seven away games in 11 days with a 2-1 overtime win over the Philadelphia Flyers on Wednesday. The win starts Oilers’ longest road trip in 12 years, which wasn’t a good omen for a team that disembarked with a 2-5-2 record

articles.title: Alberta municipalities gather in Calgary, debate call for province to collect own property tax
articles.description: At the 2025 Alberta Municipalities Convention, a featured resolution calls on the province to collect its own education property tax, currently included on municipal tax bills.

articles.title: A 400-million-year-old plant creates water so weird it looks alien
articles.description: Researchers discovered that living horsetails act like natural distillation towers, producing bizarre oxygen isotope signatures more extreme than anything previously recorded on Earth—sometimes resembling meteorite water. articles.title: Opinion: Quebec Liberals should take a page from U.S. Democrats
articles.description: Voters don't want to be told what to fear; they want something to believe in. That's the lesson from Mamdani and others.

articles.title: Flint Firebirds get past London Knights in mid-week matchup
articles.description: The Flint Firebirds held on to edge the London Knights 3-2 on Nov. 12 at the Dort Financial Centre. Flint outshot London 36-28.

articles.title: Labour tribunal approves full STM strike this weekend
articles.description: Bus drivers and metro operators at the Société de transport de Montréal (STM) may go on strike this weekend. articles.description: It’s an attractive idea: shaking up Toronto’s zoning laws so you can shop, eat and drink right where you live. articles.title: House passes bill to end historic government shutdown, sending measure to Trump
articles.description: Republicans used their slight majority to get the bill over the finish line with a mostly party-line vote of 222-209. The Senate has already passed the measure.

articles.title: 87-year-old USask student graduates, seeks to keep Cree language alive
articles.description: Louise Fraser made history Wednesday as one of the oldest graduates from the University of Saskatchewan and she hopes to use her knowledge to keep the Cree language alive.

articles.description: The city says its expanded efforts to crack down on fare evasion on transit buses are making a difference.

articles.title: Jack Dorsey funds diVine, a Vine reboot that includes Vine’s video archive
articles.description: Jack Dorsey backs diVine, a Vine reboot that includes Vine's video archive of six-second, looping videos. A new app called diVine will give access to more than 100,000 archived Vine videos, restored from an older backup that was created before Vine's shutdown.
